clinical_study.brief_title: A Modified (Retro-Tubercle) Opening Wedge High Tibial Osteotomy Versus the Conventional Technique
clinical_study.official_title: A Modified (Retro-Tubercle) Opening Wedge High Tibial Osteotomy Versus the Conventional Technique

lead_sponsor.agency: Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences

clinical_study.source: Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The present study was conducted among a group of Iranian patients suffering from varus knee in order to compare advantages and disadvantages of ROWHTO (Retro-Tubercle Opening Wedge High Tibial Osteotomy) technique when compared with previously described approaches of opening-wedge osteotomy.

detailed_description.textblock: There are various methods for correcting varus deformity; therefore the best surgical method must be individualized. We concluded that in a varus knee where only correction in the coronal plane without patella infra, changes in Q- angle, tibial plateau inclination is all that is needed, a retro- tubercle medial opening- wedge osteotomy is the preferred approach.

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patellar length (in mm)to the patellar tendon length (in mm)
primary_outcome.description: The length of the patella (in its longest diameter on a lateral x-ray) to the length of the patellar tendon is referred as Insall-Salvati index

primary_outcome.measure: The proportion of patellar articular surface length (in mm)to the patella-tibial plateau distance (in mm)
primary_outcome.description: The length of the articular surface of the patella to the distance from the patella to the tibial plateau is referred as Blackburne-Peel index.

secondary_outcome.description: The angle between the quadriceps vector and the line of pull of the patellar tendon from the centre of the patella to the tibial tubercle.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inclination of proximal tibial plateau in degree
secondary_outcome.description: The angle between articular surface and lateral longitudinal axis of tibia.

arm_group.description: Medial Opening-Wedge Osteotomy (MOWO) is an approach for the correction of malalignment of the knee

intervention.description: Retro-Tubercle Opening-Wedge High Tibial Osteotomy (ROWHTO) is among the latest approaches for the treatment of varus deformity of knee.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- symptomatic varus deformity of the knee with 2 or more degrees of anatomical axis varus without ligament injury
Exclusion Criteria:
- fractures through compartments of the knee or the patella
- osteoarthritis other than in the medial compartment
- 10 degrees or more extension lag
- tibial malrotation
